definitions.definition: not directly caused by or resulting from something.
examples: full employment would have an indirect effect on wage levels

definitions.definition: not done directly; conducted through intermediaries.
examples: the nature of the threat can be pieced together only from indirect evidence

definitions.definition: (of costs) deriving from overhead charges or subsidiary work.
(of taxation) levied on goods and services rather than income or profits.
(of a route) not straight; not following the shortest way.
examples: roundabout, circuitous, wandering, meandering, serpentine, winding, tortuous, zigzag the indirect route

definitions.definition: (of lighting) from a concealed source and diffusely reflected.
denoting a free kick from which a goal may not be scored directly.
avoiding direct mention or exposition of a subject.
examples: an indirect attack on the Senator
